page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: At the top end of the{High St.}sits our Tarrystone.Originally it was a boundary stone marking the extent of the property if the Abbot of {Cirencester.}During the reign of{Henry {VII}it stood where the{Memorial}now stands and marked the spot where village sports were held every year on {Assumption Day}for the entertainment of the{Royals}from Windsor.Later in the village history{Stephen Venables, owner of the paper mill at{Lullebrook decided to take the stone as decoration for his garden at Mill House.As he was a man of some importance it was not until his death in 1835 that{Sir George Young reclaimed it for the village and reinstated it at the top of the{High {St. { Sir Stanley Spencer}was an artist of some note who lived and worked in the
